summary: After the cataclysmic events in New York with his fellow Avengers, Steve Rogers, aka Captain America (Chris Evans), lives in the nation's capital as he tries to adjust to modern times. An attack on a S.H.I.E.L.D. colleague throws Rogers into a web of intrigue that places the whole world at risk. Joining forces with the Black Widow (Scarlett Johansson) and a new ally, the Falcon, Rogers struggles to expose an ever-widening conspiracy, but he and his team soon come up against an unexpected enemy.

reviews.content: This movie can really make you tense while watching it.
A wonderful action thriller which in the modern marvel age is refreshing because of its more adult orientation,  less sci-fi,  more real life.

This was the peak of the SHIELD story arc and also produced the best tie in with the TV show Agents of SHIELD. The acting, the story, the fighting, this is top notch action movie, and if not the top spot in the top 3 of all MCU movies up to Endgame.

Unarguably, the best phase for the character of Steve Rogers was Captain America: The Winter Solider. Filled with amazingly directed and authentic fight scenes, this movie keeps you on it's toes the whole time. The suit for Captain America, in my opinion was the best one he ever had. Sam Wilson's Falcon is a fine rookie character, James Buchanan Barnes aka 'Bucky' was the perfect antagonist for this film, and the character of Natasha Romanoff, as always, shines throughout.

this movie is just really solid. A compelling plot, with Steve and Bucky really shining. Also most of the action in this movie is pretty good but the pacing in this movie is a lot better than the first as it feels like the writers knew they could have some slow scenes in this movie. Overall a solid film

Captain America: The Winter Soldier is a highly entertaining and action-packed film that delivers on all fronts. From the excellent performances of its cast to its intense fight scenes and gripping plot, this movie is a must-see for any Marvel fan. I highly recommend it!

Maybe the best MCU film to date. I was never a Captain America fan and never would have ever predicted the second film in a trilogy about him would be so good. I mean, yes, it is a popcorn chomper, and not the rarest of high dramas, but it is just great. It's like - "what if we made a really good Jason Bourne / James Bond movie... but gave the characters superpowers?"
absolutamente intrigante,llena de accion, espias y momentos emocionantes que te pegan a la pantalla sin duda la mejor de la trilogia y el mejor producto del ucm solo por debajo de infinity war
Best captain America movie!

Shaky Cam and Rehashed Action Ruins It

Moviegoers above the age of 13 will recognize most of the action set pieces and plot elements from other films. There's an elevator fight, which we've seen before. Evil cops, evil suits, "big brother" danger, some running from fire and more explosions.

The fundamental problem with these movies is that you never feel like the main characters are in any danger. No matter how much of a beating Captain America takes, he's going to live to make sequels. The same goes for all of the popular cast members. Given the immortality of the good guys, the only question is How they're going to get out of peril. Don't expect anything new here.

The best writing is happening on television, sadly. Film-quality writing is going to HBO and independent networks, and television directors are moving to the big screen.

This one is all washed up. Hail hydra.
This is my favorite MCU movie man what a movie

This movie is definitely the best of the trilogy.The action and suspense are on point and I like the ending to this movie.The winter shoulder twist hits hard as well.My one complaint is that showing Peggy in this movie abandons the great ending of the first film but besides that great movie.
-8/10

What do you get, when you combine a 70s paranoia thriller with a comicbook action film that completely deconstructs the protagonist's entire belief system and worldview in the cruelest way imaginable? You get, Captain America: The Winter Soldier.

This film is arguably the best marvel cinematic universe film to have ever been produced. It has everything you can ask from a comic-book film and not only that, it elevates itself by giving personal conflicts for almost every character in the film and packs a necessary emotional punch that you rarely see in these films.

As Steve Rogers struggles to embrace his role in the modern world, he teams up with a fellow avenger and S.H.I.E.L.D agent, Black Widow, to battle a new threat from history: an assassin known as the Winter Soldier. I just wrote the IMDb plot synopsis because it is the best way to go into this film without any spoilers. Although we all expected it and knew it, the moment we see that face, it's terrifying and heartbreaking at the same time.

The acting is just, phenomenal. Chris Evans gives the best performance he has ever given in these films and this film takes him to his darkest and lowest point of life because he loses his faith in the government, loses his best friend, is almost about to lose the love of his life, but he still has one thing clear in life and is still willing to give up his life for it which is, to do what's right, no matter if he has to go against the entire world for it. Scarlett Johansson also gives a great performance here, this is the first film in the entire MCU where her character actually seems to have some weight and stakes here. She never felt like a character before this and always seemed to be there just because she's black widow. Here however, she has some development and she begins a character arc that actually goes on to have a great end by the end of Avengers: Endgame.

The soundtrack composed by Henry Jackman is also really good. The gothic theme provided for the winter soldier gives me chills every time. Amazing work.

This, along with The Batman are what I consider to be perfect CBMs and I wonder if they can be topped anytime soon
Huge Cap fan and thought it was a great portrayal. Awesome cast and loved the grittier feel.

This is the best standalone MCU movie hands down. The music, action directing, twists and emotional suspense, the political espionage element of the plot, THIS is an epic superhero movie and solidifies Chris Evans's Captain America as a legend!
pretty good movie. great action

"Captain America: The Winter Soldier" is a 2014 action/adventure film directed by Anthony and Joe Russo and starring Chris Evans as Steve Rogers/Captain America. The film takes place two years after the events of "The Avengers" and finds Rogers working for S.H.I.E.L.D., where he uncovers a conspiracy that threatens to endanger the world as he knows it.

One of the biggest strengths of the film is its plot, which is a tense and thrilling political thriller that keeps the audience on the edge of their seats. The film's screenplay, by Christopher Markus and Stephen McFeely, is well-crafted and keeps the story moving at a brisk pace. The film's themes of security versus freedom also feel particularly relevant in today's world.

The acting in the film is top-notch, with Chris Evans delivering a standout performance as Captain America. Scarlett Johansson is also excellent as Natasha Romanoff/Black Widow, and the chemistry between the two characters is electric. The supporting cast, which includes Samuel L. Jackson as Nick Fury and Robert Redford as Alexander Pierce, is also strong.

The action scenes in the film are well-staged and exciting, with a mix of hand-to-hand combat and high-tech gadgets. The film's cinematography, by Trent Opaloch, is also impressive, with a mix of wide shots and close-ups that help to create a sense of tension and urgency.

The direction by the Russo brothers is confident and assured, with a good sense of pacing and a strong visual style. The film's score, by Henry Jackman, is also effective, with a mix of memorable themes and tense, suspenseful cues.

Overall, "Captain America: The Winter Soldier" is a fantastic entry in the Marvel Cinematic Universe, with a strong plot, excellent acting, and well-executed action scenes. While some viewers may find the film's themes a bit heavy-handed, it is ultimately an enjoyable ride that will leave viewers eager for more adventures with Captain America and his allies.

Masterpiece. Absolute masterpiece. I expect nothing less from the Russo's who started their mcu journey off with a bang. It's a perfect sequel, it's action packed, extremely gripping and has a conspiracy vibe that no other mcu film has. The winter soldier is a perfect villain, and his connection to Steve's past makes their interactions so much deeper. I wish Marvel made more movies like this. 10/10 instant classic
wow this is a fun movie

Avoided this movie for years. Big mistake!

This is the only sequel I can think of in recent times that is better than the first film. It's absolutely heart wrenching and tragic! Imagine living in a world where all your family and friends have long passed...and out of nowhere your lifelong best-friend you thought had died a long time ago is still alive and trying freaking to kill you. Damn.

Idk, I think it's a masterpiece. An instant classic.
Excellent movie. Mature, emotional, and fun at the same time.
Best Marvel movie in my opinion best action, fight sequences, and just peak Captain America. Chris Evans and everyone in this film just kills it.
A great and serious Marvel movie!
In the Top 3 of Best Marvel Movies, & back when Marvel movies were actually good.

The Russo Brothers' introductory MCU film is an unforgettable one. This is by far the best MCU film in Phase 2 and up until this point was the best MCU film. Well shot, the fight choreography was superb, and the acting was top-tier. An amazing ride!

Another Marvel Classic. So many blended high stakes and dramatic elements you would not expect from a "superhero" movie. Dare I say. genre bending entry the likes of Logan and the Dark Knight Trilogy? The Russo Brothers deserve the credit here for establishing their footprint while seriously advancing one of the strongest and most compelling narrative threads in the entirety of the MCU. Bravo!

Great way to reintroduce Bucky Barnes as The Winter Solider, one of marvels best projects, only flaw is I didn't like how Black Widow and Steve Rogers were acting flirty in this movie, just felt a bit weird.

I liked the suspense and action in this movie, I also like how you don't know who the winter soldier is. A excellent movie and an absolute must see. Captain America and the winter soldier are some of my favorite parts of this movie. 8.5/10

Captain America: The Winter Soldier once again features Chris Evans playing the titular character in a perfect, soothing way, which is made even more appealing by its all-star supporting cast, incredible mcu-defining action sequences, sensational themes and athmosphere, funny and witty nature, ignited emotional strings and its courage to explore new arenas all make this evident superhero gem a must-see for superhero fans and non-superhero fans alike.

The beginning of an action movie (marvel) era
This is Marvel at it's best. A solid, compelling storyline. Incredible CGI. Great acting. Great ties to other films. All in all, one of the best Marvel movies yet.

"Captain America: The Winter Soldier" is an exceptional entry in the Marvel Cinematic Universe that not only delivers on thrilling action sequences but also features a compelling story and great performances from its cast. The film showcases some of the best action sequences seen in any superhero movie, with the hand-to-hand combat scenes being particularly impressive. The film's story is engaging, with twists and turns that keep the audience on the edge of their seats. The dynamic between Chris Evans' Captain America and Scarlett Johansson's Black Widow is also a highlight, with the two actors delivering strong performances and displaying great chemistry on screen. Overall, "Captain America: The Winter Soldier" is a fantastic movie that balances action, storytelling, and character development in a way that few superhero films can match.

When people talk about the groundbreakers of the MCU, they usually point to films like Guardians or the Avengers movies. But, while not underrated, people do leave out just how incredible Captain America The Winter Soldier truly is.
The heroes and villains have great motivations, the action is some of the most grounded and awesome in the MCU, the themes of freedom vs security are interesting, and while the tone is gritty, it never loses its sense of fun. 
If I have any nitpicks with the film, honestly, they are too small to do any real damage.
This truly is one of the most emotionally endearing, thematically intriguing, and awesomely action-packed superhero films ever made! It stands toe to toe with films like Infinity War and The Dark Knight, and I feel like some people do forget that.
Best "solo" Marvel movie.
One of the best comic book movies ever made. The story was great and the casting was done well. The bits of cgi needed were done well.

Absolutely an enjoyable and well done action movie. The espionage tone is exceptional, the suspense atmosphere always keeps you on your toes, direction and interpretations are perfect. As central as it is to the MCU macro-plot, it can also be watched as a standalone movie. Truly one of the best among marvel movies but also among all cinecomics.

It's one of the best Marvel movies! It has a different atmosphere that perfectly matched the film's proposal and its characters. The story is very good and intelligent, wonderful characters, remarkable effects and scenes and impeccable music.

Captain America - The Winter Soldier is definitely one of the best films in the MCU. After the not entirely failure of Thor - The Dark World, Captain America 2 raises phase 2. Offering some spy-movie atmospheres that I particularly appreciated and that work with the character of Cap. Finally in Phase 2 we see an interesting villain. In fact, the Winter Soldier to me is a villain that works and gives good moments of action and quite creepy moments. The action scenes are well shot and also coordinated. Captain America - The Winter Soldier is one of the best films in the MCU, beautiful and fun
BRO THE START WAS WEIRD BUT I FELL IN LOVE WITH THE WINTER SOLDIER

Captain America: The Winter Soldier is a big improvement to its already good predecessor, and the politics in this movie is just awesome and blends in to the plot. When Cap realizes he can't trust anyone, the movie takes a fairly serious tone.
